newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-BHP appoints new copper division CEO.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-BHP appoints new copper division CEO.

text.p: The Broken Hill Pty Co Ltd said on Thursday that the current president and chief executive of BHP Copper, Burgess Winter, would retire from January 1, and be replaced by Jim Lewis, who is currently BHP's executive general management of corporate development.
BHP managing director John Prescott paid tribute to Winter's role in the integration of Magma Copper Co, bought by BHP in January for US$2.4 billion, into the group.

"The group's unique combination of ore bodies, expertise, management, upstream and downstream technologies, competencies and people means (BHP Copper) is well placed to develop as the world's major private copper company," he said.
Precott said Lewis, 53, had been in his present role since 1993 and would bring to BHP Copper considerable general management and strategic planning experience.
At 0005 GMT (11.05 a.m.) BHP shares were down 16 cents to A$17.39.
